channel.title: Adding Models [REP++ FOR HELP]
channel.description: i want to make my own models and i recently found a tutorial and i followed it and understood most of it. what i didn't understand is how to add it into the client. i am not sure wether to make it a winrar archive or a .dat file or .mqo file or what. and do i just add it to the model folder or do i have to do something to it?

item.title: Adding Models [REP++ FOR HELP]
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

First make sure that the .MQO file has been converted and animated in DatMaker, so that it is now a .DAT file. Then open the .DAT file with GZip, and rename the files to two numbers you will use in your ints for Class8.java. If they do not show up in your client, type “add models #####” or “add model #####” (replacing ##### with the file’s number), and then the model will show up.

Read full topic

item.title: Adding Models [REP++ FOR HELP]
item.dc:creator: @coalman58 coalman58
item.description:
@coalman58 wrote:

you drag and drop the model you want to gzip and it turns into (modl).gz
then just either copy it and paste it to your models folder or drag and drop it in the models folder
